title: Sprint glory for Kevin Ryan's Glass Slipper as British stables enjoy success despite Enable defeat
text:
There was no joy for Enable but British stables did not leave Longchamp on Arc day empty handed.

Favourite Battaash was another sunk in the mud in the Prix De L'Abbaye but the five-furlong prize was decisively won by Glass Slipper, trained by Kevin Ryan.

Then Arc winning jockey Pierre-Charles Boudot teamed up with trainer William Haggas to win the Prix de la Foret on One Master for the second year running.

Tom Eaves romped to victory on the Kevin Ryan trained Glass Slipper at Longchamp

Irish trainer Jessica Harrington won the Prix Marcel Boussac winner Albigna, who currently tops the pecking order in a very strong pack of two-year-old fillies in her stable.

Harrington won the Group One Cheveley Park Stakes with another filly Millisle just over a week ago and is due to run unbeaten Cayenne Pepper in Friday's Group One Fillies' Mile at Newmarket.

While Godolphin's strong hand of two-year-old colts looks even stronger after Andre Fabre's Victor Ludorum won the Prix Jean-Luc Lagardere.
description: MARCUS TOWNEND AT LONGCHAMP: There was no joy for Enable but British stables did not leave Longchamp on Arc day empty handed as Kevin Ryan's Glass Slipper won decisively.
authors: Marcus Townend For The Daily Mail
